meanings.definition: Not pleasant or agreeable in taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The unsavoury smell of rotten eggs filled the room.
meanings.sent2: The unsavoury taste of the medicine made him grimace.
meanings.sent3: The unsavoury odor from the garbage can made everyone hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The unsavoury aroma of burnt popcorn lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The unsavoury flavor of the spoiled milk was unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The unsavoury character of the villain made him despised by all.
meanings.sent2: The unsavoury behavior of the criminal shocked the community.
meanings.sent3: The unsavoury joke he told at the party fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The unsavoury actions of the corrupt politician were exposed.
meanings.sent5: The unsavoury decision to cheat on the test haunted her conscience.
